label: 畿内
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: in Japan, essentially the coalescent core" and its frontier. A concept referring to the king's domain that was adopted in the seventh century from such Chinese classics as the Chou li, it came to refer to Yamato and four neighboring provinces, making five or "go kinai" provinces: Yamato, Yamashiro, Kawachi, Settsu, Izumi. [五畿内、大和、山城、河内、摂津、和泉] "
